title.value: The Past, Present, and Future of the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS)
title.justification: This is the title provided at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: The Past, Present, and Future of the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS)

extractions.description: The paper discusses the history, current status, and future directions of the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS), a community-driven standard for organizing neuroscience data. It outlines the principles behind BIDS, the process of its development, and the technological and social infrastructure supporting its success, challenges, and lessons learned.

type.justification: The paper primarily provides a historical and conceptual overview of the BIDS standard rather than presenting new empirical research findings.
type.quote: In this paper we outline the history, current status, and future directions of the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS), which has become a widely accepted community-driven data standard within the neuroscience community. The goal of this exposition is to provide a written history of the events that gave rise to BIDS and outline the events leading to its establishment, which we hope will be of interest to researchers in the neuroimaging field as well as to those in other fields working to establish successful new data standards.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on the organization, sharing, and standardization of brain imaging data.
name.quote: The sharing of scientific research data is beneficial in numerous ways... Given the rise of machine learning methods in science, another unsung benefit of data sharing is that it provides larger and more diverse training datasets, which can increase robustness and decrease overfitting and bias.

name.justification: The paper deals extensively with the technical standards and informatics infrastructure needed for organizing and sharing neuroimaging data.
name.quote: We outline the principles behind the project, the mechanisms by which it has been extended, and some of the challenges being addressed as it evolves.

name.justification: The paper mentions the benefits of data sharing for machine learning purposes, specifically for increasing the size and diversity of training datasets.
